content: in the same space as last double_crochet 3dc in the next space around the double_crochet repeat around the next double_crochet ©ashleymaglich now you will be making 3dc around the last double_crochet in each of the next 10 clusters down ©ashleymaglich ©ashleymaglich you are now at the first 3dc cluster we made at the beginning in between the first 2 double_crochet stitches you are going to make 2dc & ch1 you are now going to make 2dc between the second & last double_crochet of that same cluster ©ashleymaglich now you will be making 3dc around the last double_crochet in each of the next 10 clusters down just like the other side ©ashleymaglich 3dc around each double_crochet space for the next 7 spaces ©ashleymaglich single_crochet between the 2 double_crochet in the center ©ashleymaglich 3dc around the next 3 double_crochet stitches ©ashleymaglich 3dc between the next 2 clusters slip_stitch in the top of the 1st double_crochet in the next cluster ©ashleymaglich step 12 is going to be our border round if you want your border to be a different color you can fo & attach your new color in the same place you made your slip_stitch ch1 & single_crochet back into that same stitch if you are continuing with the same color you will just need to ch1 & single_crochet back into that same stitch step 12 you will be making a single_crochet in each stitch around in the point ch1 space make single_crochet ch1 single_crochet in the same space ©ashleymaglich when you get back to the v of the heart you will need to place a single_crochet on each side of the single_crochet in the center slip_stitch to the 1st single_crochet ©ashleymaglich step 13 ch3 and single_crochet into the 3rd stitch repeat this until you have 13 chain spaces ch3 and single_crochet into the ch1 at the point ch3 and single_crochet into the 3rd stitch like you did for the other side all the way around until you reach your starting point ©ashleymaglich step 14 in the ch3 space make 8dc in the same space single_crochet in the next ch3 space repeat this until you have 7 8dc clusters in the ch3 space at the point you will make single_crochet 1/2dc double_crochet ch1 in the next ch3 space at the point you will make double_crochet 1/2dc single_crochet 8dc in the next ch3 space single_crochet in the next ch3 space repeat this until you have 8 8dc cluster spaces ©ashleymaglich in the next 4 ch3 spaces make 2sc in each space ©ashleymaglich make 8dc in the next ch3 space single_crochet in the next ch3 space slip_stitch into the single_crochet from the beginning & fo sew in any loose ends you may have your heart is now complete ©ashleymaglich there is so much potential for this heart pattern here are some ideas off the top of my head but please let your imagination take hold i can t wait to see what you create *table runner place mats bags doll blankets/rugs i m sure
